name: Aaamazzarite
summary: Hairless humanoids that create objects biochemically from their mouths; also known as Therbians

name: Aalaag
source: Gordon R. Dickson's Way of the Pilgrim
summary: Nine foot tall alabaster-skinned and white-haired humanoids with a biological instinct for racial-preservation instead of a human instinct for self-preservation, known as The Immaculate People in their language

name: Abh
summary: Genetically-enhanced humans

name: Abu Chacha
summary: Humanoid

name: Abzorbalof
summary: Human-absorbing humanoid

name: Abyormenites
summary: floating balloons

name: Acquarans
summary: Humanoid

name: Adipose
summary: Tiny, round humanoids made of fat

name: Advent
summary: Humanoid

name: Aenar
summary: Telepathic humanoid

name: Aerophibian
summary: Manta ray-like humanoids from the misty planet Aeropela, who can fly and swim at supersonic speeds, accelerate to speeds greater than light, and shoot neuroshock blasts from their eyes and tails to disable a victim's nervous system.

name: Akiss
summary: Very large and dangerous reptilian animal in the mythology of the Race. It is comparable to Earth's mythical dragons.

name: Akrennians
summary: Rat/hyena-like humanoids who apparently do not dream (or bathe much); the character Preed is an Akrennian. The food "Akrennian Beetle Sushimi" is also featured in the film, hinting that insect-like life-forms are also found on their home planet.

name: Albategna
summary: Large black-and-white creatures with six tentacular limbs (two for walking and four for manipulating)

name: The Alien
source: Satyajit Ray's The Alien and Banku Babu's Friend

name: Alien
summary: Parasitic and having the capability to possess its host

name: Alien Frogs
summary: An alien species like frogs: James and his family

name: Alien Husbands
summary: This species of aliens is Gray,  Tree Trunks' five alien husbands

name: Altarians
summary: Humanoid

name: Amazonians
summary: Giant humanoid women. Men of this species have died out.

name: Amnioni
summary: Humanoid

name: Anabis
source: The Voyage of the Space Beagle by A. E. van Vogt

name: Ancients
summary: Technologically advanced beings that were wiped out several thousand years ago.  Unknown physical description.

name: Ancient
summary: Humans from Earth, with a developed intelligence, who in the age of the creation of the pyramids, left Earth for universe exploration.

name: Andalites
summary: Centaur-like aliens, they have non-poisonous scorpion tails as a formidable weapon. They lack mouths, so they use a technique called "thought-speak", similar to but not quite telepathy, and they have four eyes: two on their face, and two on stalks that give them 360 degree vision. They are the main enemies of the villainous Yeerks.

name: Andorians
summary: Humanoid with blue skin, white hair, antennae

name: Annari
summary: Humanoid

name: Anodite
summary: Free-spirited humanoid energy beings from the planet Anodyne, who can draw life from the mana around them. Old enough Anodites can use this manipulate reality, while even younger ones have a strong connection to magic.

name: Antarans
summary: Marauders exiled to a pocket dimension

name: Anterians
source: The Suite Life on Deck & Cocoon.

name: Appoplexian
summary: Muscular tiger-like humanoids from the planet Apploplexia. They value emotional openness, but this can be a problem since their primary emotion is rage, and they are proud fighters. Primarily, they use claws on their wrists that elongate when their rage increases, but are skilled in wrestling, though are fatally vulnerable to certain high pitched noises.

name: Arachnichimp
summary: Four-eyed, four-armed monkey-like aliens from the jungle planet Arahnascimmia, they have the ability to produce strong webbing from their tails.

name: Arachnoids
summary: Scorpion-like

name: Arburian Pelarota
summary: Functionally extinct due to the destruction of their home planet Arburia, they are bulky yellow aliens that can curl into a ball, much like a pillbug, and are very hard to damage in ball form, and they use this to crush enemies either by bouncing around or rolling over them

name: Argolin
summary: Humanoid

name: Arilou Lalee'lay
summary: Humanoid - 'Grey' alien

name: Airlia
source: Area 51 novel series by Robert Doherty
summary: Humanoid, see moai

name: Asari
summary: Blue-skinned feminine humanoids

name: Aschen
summary: Humanoid

name: Asgard
summary: Grey humanoid

name: Aslan
summary: Feline humanoid

name: Atavus
summary: Humanoid

name: Atevi
summary: Tall, dark, mysterious humanoids. Culture progresses rapidly from steam-age to contemporary and beyond perhaps due to their numerological language. Assassin's Guild rather than police.

name: Autobot
summary: A machine race that can transform between a humanoid form and that of a certain machine, depending on the specific Autobot

name: Autons
summary: Living plastic beings

name: Azwaca
summary: A large stock animal native to Home and used by the Race as food. They are also edible to humans. The Colonization Fleet brought azwaca and several other species of livestock to Tosev 3 (Earth). As Earth plants were not equipped to deal with the extremely economic grazing patterns of these animals, some ecological damage resulted. This in turn led to diplomatic tensions between the Race and the various human powers that shared borders with Lizard-territory.
